Reviews.Title: “If I could, I'd give it 4.5”
Reviews.Author: gam70
Reviews.Content: This was exactly what we needed -- centrally located, two bedroom suite w/ kitchenette, lots of space, a nice pool on the penthouse floor with a great view of the city (some reviewers have complained it was cold, but we thought it was fine and our kids had a blast), clean, reasonable beds, pleasant staff. We got our 2-br suite for $CDN165 online. I honestly don't know how we could have done a Montreal getaway weekend otherwise. Our kids are 3 and 1 years old, and usually in bed by 7:30 p.m. When I was a kid, I recall my dad sitting in the bathroom reading a newspaper after the lights went out when us kids crashed in a small hotel room with two queen beds. Now that I'm a dad, I know I couldn't do that. It just isn't a vacation. Two tiny downsides in my opinion: 1. Parking isn't onsite. It's a 50 metre (yard) walk down the hill at the Delta Hotel. It is a bit of a circuitous drive to get there from L'Appartement Hotel, with all the one-way streets, but the walk is an easy one, particularly after we realized there is a back door to the Delta that is right across from the parking elevator. L'Appartement lets you load and unload your vehicle from a few short-term parking spots right behind their facility. We ended up parking our vehicle for the entire trip and taking the metro (the kids enjoyed the train and we didn't have to worry about find parking) so this wasn't a huge inconvenience for us. Next time we go back to Montreal, we're definitely going back. 2. In our room, the walls seemed a bit thinner than they perhaps could be. Our first night, around 11 p.m. there was a bit of noise from another room, we think above us. As soon as my wife called reception the sound stopped like a switch had been flipped.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Kevin S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedrooms apartment. The apartment was vast and fully equipped with sofa, TV, telephone, internet access, kitchen, oven, dishes, dinning table, etc. It has everything you need. However, the cleanliness was at the limit of my tolerance. The carpet smelled and the sofa also. The curtains were a little bit discolored (or I should say colored by foreign substances). The bathroom was acceptable. Globally, it was not dirty, but simply aging. The buffet breakfast was standard; there is just enough variety to not be bored, but the quality is average. I didnâ€™t have time to try the swimming pool. The strength of this hotel is its location. Indeed, it is located downtown on one of the biggest streets of the city. It is full of restaurants around. You can easily walk to the major shopping areas or to Chinatown. The subway station is really close. It is only few steps away from the cultural area and the summer festivals. The location is almost ideal and Montreal is the place to be during the summer with its old town, terraces, F1 race, Cirque du Soleil, and all the festivals. I hate carpet and especially smelly ones. So I kept the window open all the time and it is noisy all day and all night outside because of the traffic. It is the price to pay to be downtown. Because it is located in downtown, the price is very affordable for what you get. It is an interesting alternative if you travel in group. It really depends on what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_Food_Junkie
Reviews.Content: For the price, this two bedroom appartment, with kitchen and living area, offered great value in downtown Montreal. It was clean, but smelled a little bit musty - luckily the windows opened, and I bought flowers to brighten things up. Everything may not have been in perfect repair, but nothing was unuseable or defective. If you don't need the chocolates on the pillow, and want to spend more time exploring the city than hanging out in your hotel room, L'Appartement hotel will work well for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great for family with small children”
Reviews.Author: vlafortune
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Appartement Hotel. We stayed in a one bedroom appartment during three nights in December (Christmas time). The pool was a definite highlight for our two kids (3 and 5 years old), even though it was a bit cold and our older one barely touched the pool floor. We liked this hotel better than the square phillips (4 stars) because the room was cozier (more like a real appartement). On the negative side, the sofabed was really soft and short. It could hardly hold more than one adult. Still, sleep quality was great (no noise!). Also, breakfast time was a bit crowdy, but it was always possible to bring food to the room. Many thanks for this great breakaway in Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Love the location and great value”
Reviews.Author: SaraJaneC5
Reviews.Content: Pros - great location, great value, the staff were so helpful, breakfast was awesome, the rooms are huge and with lots of room, free wifi Cons - the pool was chilly and too cold to go in and enjoy and the sauna was not on so you'd have to wait for it to heat up.

Reviews.Title: “Great for large groups”
Reviews.Author: ktnmnhr
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 2 bedroom suite in early October with 3 friends for one night and it is well worth the money. It was spacious, clean, and was head and shoulders better than getting two single rooms. Definitely recommend for two couples or a group of friends.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: nikosgeo
Reviews.Content: Stayed on Dec 2011, overnight, after a long drive from New York and choose this hotel after a short pass from the other 2-3 hotels that are located nearby, holliday inn and others. This hotel was 15-20% cheaper and it was reccomended on TA so we thought to give a try. The interior is not something special but everything is very clean. The reception desk was very helpful and we felt very welcome. The rooms are very spacy, quiet and clean. Free wifi all over the hotel. The quality of sleep (which for me counts for >80%) was very good as the matress, pillows and the sheets quality was very good. The towels were puffy and the bathroom was also big enough. The breakfast was fantastic ! Not very big variety (though above average) but everything was VERY fresh and tasty ! Parking is available for 20$ per day (the other hotels were asking for 27$-30$ !). All in all we will return if we'll be in the city, totally reccomended. Have a great time in Montreal whatever you'll choose to do, thanks for reading my review.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay for my 60th birthday trip....”
Reviews.Author: pnicol
Reviews.Content: I had wanted to stay here for a long time and it finally worked out. Went to Montreal for my 60th birthday. When we checked in, we were told that we had been upgraded from a bachelor to a one bedroom.That was sweet news. The one bedroom was cosy and we had a great view of Mont Royal and the cross that was lit up(at night).We were on the15th floor. This made it very handy for going up to the swimming pool and sauna on the top floor(17th -I believe). The hotel was centrally located. You could walk to 'Old Montreal' or St . Catherine's Street amongst other locations.If you wanted to come back for a break-it was easy to do. Brakfast was included. You could choose from bagels, muffins, croissants,various types of bread(for toast), cereal, yogurt and a variety of fruit. Of course, there was also juices, coffee and tea. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Steve & Sheila”
Reviews.Author: Soundsman
Reviews.Content: We had good clean modern apartment on 8th. Floor. Good location, paying car park at the back. Small deck garden & indoor pool on top, 16th. floor. Lifts slow coming at times especially. on upper floors. Computer in Breakfast room for internet. Very good serve yourself Breakfast as much as you like. No thick curtains to cover bedroom windows, only net ones!! & pretend ones.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient and spacious”
Reviews.Author: shanoa
Reviews.Content: L'Appartement Hotel is extremely clean and conveniently located on Sherbrooke Street West, steps away from a bus stop and a short walking distance from the metro. The rooms are spacious and the hotel offers a grocery shopping service which is very helpful. The deck looks out to Mont Royal. Wireless internet is free as is the continental breakfast. All in all an excellent choice for a stay in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Apartments located in the right place”
Reviews.Author: Ruperto
Reviews.Content: Good apartment hotel located on Sherbrooke near the student ghetto, downtown and le plateau. Had a two bedroom suite on the fourth floor ($219/night), with kitchen, sitting room (sofa bed), and dining alcove. Furniture etc. are cheap but beds are fine. Would recommend getting rooms on higher floors as this is a lively (i.e. noisy) area into the early hours. Pool, saunas are fine, fitness equipment limited. Free breakfast isnt worth the trouble. There's a supermarket two blocks up. Good family and group option (hockey fans seem regulars). Nothing to write home about but a solid option for apartment stays. Owned by the same company as Square Phillips which has a bit more class but lacks the affordable two bed apartment option.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Judy94
Reviews.Content: Took advantage of the Fall Sweet deal for a 2 bedroom. Beds are very firm. Having a kitchenette and separate living room with a pull out couch was great. We asked for a room at the back of the hotel on the second floor (away from the elevator) because we brought the dog. Unfortunately, they could only give us a smoking room. The dining room chairs and the carpet were badly stained in many, many places. However, the reception did allow us to choose another room available on a higher floor, if we wished. They told us that the carpets were going to be changed next month. The staff members were very nice. The cleaning staff will come everyday if you hang the sign on the door for service. The breakfast is adequate. The location is bordering on the McGill University student "ghetto" which is very safe. No dog park around (unless we wanted to walk to the corner of Dr. Penfield & McGregor which was quite a ways especially in the rainy, cold weather we were having). So we walked the dog on the McGill grounds. Having free internet connection is a huge bonus and if you don't bring your laptop, there is a computer in the dining room. Parking is expensive ($19.50 CDN per day), but par for the course since you are downtown. The inside parking spots are very tight. I would recommend this apt/hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: RVTraveller43
Reviews.Content: We were in a 2 bedroom suite -- travelling with friends .. it was well equipped and we had a good view .. 14th floor ... the hotel has all that you could want -- swimming pool, roof top patio and a balcony off the room ... it is located right next to McGill university ..and a couple of blocks from a decent grocery store .. the free continental breakfast is a real bonus .. location is very good -- we walked to "old" Montreal, along the waterfront and locks and had poutine in the area .. suggest taking a taxi up to the top of Mount Royal then walking around and down then over for lunch at the famous Schwartz deli (go early 11:30am - to avoid long lineups) .. now for the other part of the story -- Location of the hotel is in the middle of Montreal so its very noisy with windows open -- there was also pile driving going on somewhere nearby that started at 7:00am --very noisy .. Also, this hotel may not be available for long as we heard that McGill university had bought it and was turning it into residences for students quite soon .. All in all we enjoyed our stay here and would recommend it ...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience From Beginning to End”
Reviews.Author: fromafar_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were so glad for so much great info. from the reviews on this site when we were planning the most important mini vacation that we've had in many years to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary. We stayed 3 nights and it felt like a real home away from home. Many reviews we'd read were full of accurate and useful information (we took our sedan rather than our crossover vehicle in order to fit into the parking garage and were glad we did. Our own experiences were never disappointing at L'Appartement from the moment we pulled up to the welcoming attractive front. We were looking for comfort, value and a bit of romance. Here was a place where we could feel that we were spoiling ourselves without the guilt of overspending on needless extras. No valet parking, no bell hop to carry our baggage to both demand tips; $$ that we so carefully budgeted for our get away. The cozy lobby had a touch of class feel to it, but if you're looking for up to the moment, trendy stylish glam, it might not be your best bet. If you're looking for comfortable, clean, style with friendly service, this is your place. Tired it is most certainly not. Our first impression was only enhanced by arriving at our room that had been upgraded to a suite from the studio that we had paid for. What a lovely surprise and we scored a balcony along with the extra space on the 14th floor with a nice view and windows that open for lovely fall fresh air. Although previous posters have commented that the bathroom fan didn't work (which is true) I was impressed with its cleanliness and I'm pretty picky when it comes to hotel bathrooms. I'm a little claustrophobic so initially it took a bit of getting used to being in the kitchenette and bathroom that were both pretty tiny, but "small" price to pay for such conveniences. It is rare to find both a continental breakfast and wireless internet at no extra charge. The staff were always friendly, helpful and inconspicuous. As we were a little into each other on a romantic getaway, the staff were there when we needed any thing but never really obvious which was nice. The location was simply perfect and we walked absolutely everywhere we needed to go. Close to Mont Royal, the Plateau, Old Montreal, Crescent Street, St.Catherine's. I can't imagine a better location. Only one tiny issue which was totally out of control of the hotel management, had to do with outside, really loud, construction noises beginning at 7:30am. Not something that a week end guest would experience, but a fan in the bedroom or nearby bathroom may have helped to drown out the noise. The cherry on top of the wonderful treat, was the roof top patio and pool. On my first morning, it felt like such decadence to work out on the bike, do a few laps and relax on the patio which was so tastefully decorated with lovely, colourful planters. All that said, upon paying our bill, the best surprise was no surprise. All too often the prices quoted differ so much from the end charges, but the bill was exactly as it should have been. We agree that any time we return to Montreal as a couple or as a family, we will most certainly not be staying any where but L'Appartement. Thank you for a lovely and memorable time.

Reviews.Title: “HIGH SATISFACTION”
Reviews.Author: bessiePalmSpringCa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the HotelAppartement from August 31 tthrough September 17, 2011. It was our third trip in Montreal but the first time to reserve at your hotel. We were pleasantly surprised to find such a good quality/price hotel in a perfect location, a professional and friendly staff, and a clean hotel (with the exception of the carpet and kitchen floor covering). We would recommend it spontaneously to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “improvements needed.”
Reviews.Author: sakinkedi
Reviews.Content: unfortunately carpets and couches were old and smelly. the bed was clean though!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean apartment, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: meliketotravel
Reviews.Content: We rented a 2 bedroom apartment for 3 nights over the labor day weekend. We were 2 couples and 2 kids. The staff was courteous with helping us move in the luggage. The apartment was clean, roomy and the kitchen well stocked with basic utensils. Our apartment was located on the 14th floor of the Rue Sherbrook, which is one of the main streets with a good view of the city below and the mount royal ahead. The only slight disappointment was that the balcony faced a rather rundown looking neighborhood near McGill University. A front facing balcony may have been nicer. The hotel is within 10 min walking distance of the train station and for the entire 3 days we never had to drive. The breakfast buffet is very comprehensive and they allow you to take it up to the room which is great if you are short on time like we were. In the end, the manager even gave an additional discount for AAA membership that was not published when we first booked the room. On the whole the stay was very pleasant and convenient. SN Washington D.C.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location.. Excellent Staff !”
Reviews.Author: Sachin_K_Thapa
Reviews.Content: We went to Montreal on Labour day weekend, We stayed two nights in this hotel and I would say that hotel front staff desk was very helpful in making our stay comfortable and gave us the best guidance and advises. Rooms were very comfortable and clean, we received a free upgrade and you will love the location. We were two couples and one infant 11 months old, we had a wonderful time in Montreal. If we go back again we would stay in same hotel. Thanks Michael for the nice hospitality !!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to gather to visit central Montreal”
Reviews.Author: TLTraveller
Reviews.Content: A fantastic five minute walk to St. Catherine Street where many of the major stores and restaurants are located. They ran out of parking spaces when we checked in late at night, so we had to park across the street at the Delta. We booked 3 suites between 12 people. The 2 bedroom suites were quite large with 2 separate queen beds, and a sofa bed in the living area. AC was available in the main living area and one of the bedrooms, however the 2nd bedroom only had a noisy fan. If the door was closed AC could not cool the occupants down in that 2nd bedroom. Bathroom facilities was large enough, but no exhaust fan. So when the steam seeps out from a hot shower, it would set off the fire alarm which was a nuisance. Dining table and kitchen facilities came in handy. Room was clean, but dated, however fully functional for our needs. Pluses: Free WiFi cable TV in living area and 1st bedroom. Continental breakfast (however we did not partake in) 5 minute walk to St. Catherine Street Swimming pool looked refreshing Fantastic roof top patio (other end of the swimming pool) overlooking Montreal Balcony for our suite. Pharmacy/Convenience store connected beside the hotel. Could of done better: The 7AM false fire alarm in the building that caused an evacuation Hotel parking was on a one way street, so you have to do a long circle to get back out on to Sherbrooke. A couple of harmless homeless people were sleeping just outside the hotel entrance. Not a bother, but was a little surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Good place, couple caveats”
Reviews.Author: Voost
Reviews.Content: I agree with others that this is a good place to stay for the price. I'd probably return. the location is very central and the staff is friendly. The rooms were also comfortable and staying on the 11th floor we got a great view. At the same time I agree with the critiques of the hotel although I didn't have any major problems. I did hear some of the folks in the other rooms and in the hallway so the rooms are not super quiet. The elevators are also slow, but that wasn't a big deal. Other than that this is a great place. The breakfast is also basic but good. The pool on the roof is also nice but the equipment is rundown. Final summary: A good value and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BobHARRIS10
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Great location for walking to all areas. Very friendly staff. Nice pool and patio. Lots of chlorine in the pool. Reccomended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Return customer will return again”
Reviews.Author: MassachusettsMom71
Reviews.Content: We returned to L'Appartement Hotel after a pleasant stay in 2010 and were not disappointed. Pros: spacious 1-bedroom accommodations with great TVs, nice linens and soaps, passable kitchen. Indoor parking. Convenient location. Great view from rooftop pool/fitness center. Cons: mediocre breakfast, poor quality gym equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable hotel in pleasant area”
Reviews.Author: CanberraSteve38
Reviews.Content: The hotel provides rooms and apartments with full kitchen, which was important for us. We appreciated the friendly, welcoming greeting on arrival -- and the fact that we could move into our accommodation early but we were also provided with an upgrade made us feel even more enthusiastic. The room was clean, well furnished well arranged. It had the necessary amenities and equipment that we needed for a two day stay. The air conditioning was superb given the warm temperatures outside. The complimentary continental breakfast was high quality. The hotel is located on Sherbrooke Street near McGill University. There is good shopping, good transit links and plenty of interesting walks in the area. The hotel was an ideal base for a Montreal stay.

Reviews.Title: “We were very pleased with this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: paigemg2
Reviews.Content: My husband, 6 month old, and I recently traveled to Montreal for a break from the Texas heat and were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. We stayed in a one bedroom appartment with ample room and a good layout. There was a single bedroom with a door, so we could watch TV without disturbing our sleeping baby. We kept her in the pack and play in the dining room, although there was plenty of room for her in other parts of the apartment. The workout facilities left something to be desired, but there was a really cute deck on the top floor of the hotel. Breakfast was nice. All in all, we were very pleased with this hotel and would definitely choose it if we return to Montreal in the future.

Reviews.Title: “good for family or couples”
Reviews.Author: Hamooz
Reviews.Content: Clean apartments, spacious and fully equipped. Not far from st catherine street ( main shopping street).

Reviews.Title: “clean, kid friendly. FUN!”
Reviews.Author: aniVermont
Reviews.Content: We tried to escape rainy Vermont with our 2 1/2 and 4 1/2 year old for a one night "get out of the rain" escape. Found the hotel on trip advisor and happy i trusted peoples opinion: very clean, very friendly- they even wheeled out a radio-flyer wagon filled with toys that the kids got to chose from- huge hit. the pool was also great- although i felt a little bad for the man trying to work out there because of the hollering kids. the sauna was also lovely. couldn't believe there was a real patio! doors that open and fresh (city) air and watching all the traffic was also a hit with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Staff”
Reviews.Author: Canadian2000
Reviews.Content: We recently booked a room at the Appartement Hotel and needed to cancel a part of our stay after a family member was released early after surgery from the McGill Institute. We had difficulties with Expedia (through which we had booked the hotel) but the staff at the Appartement Hotel showed true compassion and understanding. They went above and beyond the typical call of duty to make things go as smooth as possible for us. This was our first time at the Appartement Hotel even though we've stayed in many Montreal hotels over the last couple years. We will definetely come here again the next time we are in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: IzzatBamieh
Reviews.Content: The hotel located near one of the best montreal attractions : parc de monte real. Our oval all stay was great,so clean, spacious and near everything. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than decent digs for a decent price!”
Reviews.Author: JessieBflo
Reviews.Content: We had two kids ages 6 and 2 in tow for a winter break holiday. The bed in the bedroom was quite hard ( hub threw out his back) and major con of no tv in the one bedroom and final negative of no dishwasher( I seriously question the cleanliness of the dishes) . Other than that the breakfast was quite decent and Montreal is quite wonderful !! Decent family digs on a bit of a budget !!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Becca_Ontario
Reviews.Content: Three girlfriends and I shared a room at L'Appartement in early February 2011. The location was ideal - no more than a $10 cab ride to all the hot spots in the city. It's an older hotel, but clean, quiet and comfortable. Our room had two double beds and a little kitchenette, which was useful for pre-bar activities! The price was right, the location was perfect, the rooms were clean - Montreal is always a great time. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: AJC59
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a few times in their basic suite which is really a small bachelor apartment. The rooms aren't large but they are nicely laid out. Each room has an armchair and ottoman that is actually comfortable though if there are two of you, you may be fighting over it! There is a galley kitchen as you come in which is well equipped. The decor is pleasant : not high style but relaxing, bright and clean. A continental breakfast is included that is slightly better than the "free" continental breakfasts you usually get. It includes yogurt, whole grain bread and bagels, plain instant oatmeal and fruit for those wanting healthier options. Staff are helpful without being effusive. On the downside, there are just two small elevators so if the hotel is busy, you may end up waiting a while. My advice would be to ask for a room on a lower floor so the stairs are an option if you are in a hurry. Dog owners: dogs are allowed. Although the website says "small" dogs, we stay there with 2 60lb beasts and they have never said anything. Montreal is not a dog city, so many hotels do not accept dogs or charge you a hefty fee. If you have a dog, there is a fenced in off-leash area in Parc la Fontaine about 1.5 km east of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experiance”
Reviews.Author: lulua83
Reviews.Content: You can't control in your room tempreture and the hole ways were so freeking cold. there was no extra blankets. The cleaning Lady cleaned the cups wearing same gloves the ones cleaned with the Bathroom. There's no available parking. The whole experiance was terrible, don't recommend it at all, you can pay a little more and go for a good Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, right downtown, very good service, great value.”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel231
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Appartement Hotel with my teenage daughter for 3 weeks in August. We had a very nice one bedroom apartment with a small well appointed kitchen, a living room with a good sized tv, a dining room and a small balcony with a view of Mt Royal. The furnishings are a bit old fashioned, but the apartment was very clean, bright and spacious and could comfortably sleep at least 4 people. The location is very central, on Sherbrooke St west, just steps away from McGill University, 5 mins walk to the metro, and the downtown St Catherine St shopping district and 15 mins stroll to Old Montreal. Grocery stores are also close by (they will also do your groceries for you if needed) and restaurants are within easy walking distance. There's a nice dining room on the ground floor that serves a continental buffet breakfast daily, and an indoor swimming pool, with a few treadmills,cycles and sauna rooms, on the top floor. A nice rooftop terrace is located just off the pool area. The staff were extremely courteous and helpful throughout. We will definitely stay there again when we return to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but hotel is dated and needs major renovation”
Reviews.Author: Hobbes2007
Reviews.Content: Our latest trip to Montreal was our 7th, and this was our 4th time at L'Appartement. Old (circa 1970s?) 16-floor apartment/hotel on prime corner along Sherbrooke Ouest in Montreal's Golden Square Mile. Right across is the Delta Hotel, and next to the Delta are the tall Holiday Inn and the even taller (and huge) Hilton Garden Inn. If location is your top priority, L'Appartement is a decent, inexpensive choice. Building has a nondescript brick facade with equally nondescript wrought-iron balconies for some rooms. The adjoining hotel has now been purchased by McGill University, and has been converted into student housing. Main entrance to McGill is just 2 blocks away. Nearest Metro stop is on Rue President Kennedy which is a short, 3-minute walk from the L'Appartement. Foyer is mid-sized, and reception accomodates 2-3 hotel staff. Main floor has an exit to the back which has a very small parking lot that accomodates a maximum of 6 cars. Otherwise, parking is on side street. Breakfast is free, and is served in the main floor corner room with generous views of Sherbrook st and side street. Breakfast is served at 6:30-9:30am on weekdays, and 7-10am weekends. Same fare everyday --- milk, juices, coffee, croissants, sliced bread, generic waffles, cereal, yoghurt, muffins, fruit (apples, bananas, oranges, kiwi) --- no power breakfasts with egg, bacon, sausages! There are 2 elevators which are totally inadequate for the number of guests. Same elevators are also used by cleaning/service staff, resulting in an extremely long wait during peak hours. Hallways are not airconditioned, thus creating a sauna atmosphere during the summer, especially with halogen potlights. The rooms are average in size. We have stayed in both one-bedroom and two-bedroom suites. Airconditioning is not centralized; window-type units really don't have any role in hotels. The one-bedroom unit has a single AC in the living/dining; thus, the bedroom door must be left open for cool air to enter. Bedroom has a ceiling fan. The 2-bdrm unit has 2 ACs --- one in the living/dining area, and the 2nd in the masters bdrm. Again, the smaller bdrm has only a fan. Queen bed is comfortable, and sheets/towels are always clean. The living room futon (where my 19-year-old, 6-ft-1-in son slept for 9 nights) is notoriously uncomfortable (like sleeping on a speed bump). After the 1st night, he placed the mattress on the floor and slept better after. Fridge/freezer with separate doors; toaster; coffeemaker; microwave; range/oven; and enough cooking/eating ware. Single 3-pc bath is clean but not luxurious. Lots of closet space. WiFi is free, and signal was strong anywhere in the hotel (including the open-air rooftop sun deck). On the top floor, there is a coin laundry room with 2 washers and 2 dryers that all worked well ($2 per load). Coins, detergent, fabric softener are all available for purchase at the front desk (99cents for single-load box of detergent). On the same floor, there is a sauna room, and gender-separate washrooms. On a higher level of the top floor is the freshwater indoor pool, roughly 25-30 feet in length and 12 feet in width (depth of 3.5-6.5 feet). On one side of the pool are gym equipment: 2 treadmills, a universal weights machine, 2 stationary bikes, and an elliptical trainer. Towels always available, though I once went up at 6am to use the treadmill, and all towels were dirty. On the other end of the pool is the glass door that leads to a down stairway to the open-air tanning deck (3 reclining deck chairs). Nice view of Mount Royal from the deck and pool areas. These areas are open from 6am to 10pm. If you enjoy walking, and are reasonably fit, the hotel is only 1.5 kms to Old Montreal. When I was there, I jogged every morning towards Westmount (lovely neighborhood --- reminds me of Boston or Georgetown). From the hotel to the corner of Prince Albert (few blocks west of the old city hall, or hotel de ville, of Westmount) is 3.5 kms; so the roundtrip is about 7 kms. For excellent dining, you can walk 5-10 blocks to either Saint-Denis or Blvd Saint-Laurent (fall in line for Montreal smoked meat at Schwartz Hebrew deli). To summarize, the location is unbeatable. The place itself and the prices are decent. But if you are looking for above-average comfort, let alone luxury, this hotel is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: DrizBelgium
Reviews.Content: Room 207. Clean, spacious, location good, breakfast a bit sweet but ok. No downsides to report, didn't try the AC. Maybe get a room on a higher floor than 2nd. Had the third night at 50% off (promotion), so price was good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good value overall, but hotel feels tired”
Reviews.Author: MavisOfFfarquar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks in July/August. Overall, it is good value for money, with a nice rooftop pool and good downtown location. The downside is that the hotel feels worn and the rooms are quite basic, e.g. Air Con is very old and loud (a particular problem in the summer months). With some investment this could transform from a tired 3 star to a cosy 4 star hotel. As it is, I suppose you get what you pay for!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: London, GB off the coast of Europe
Reviews.Title: “Good for longer stays, shame about the AC.”
Reviews.Author: BikerMark
Reviews.Content: We stayed at L'Appartement Hotel between 28 May and 6 June. We had a Single Studio with 1 Queen Bed on the 5th floor. The building looks a little scruffy from the outside and is very '70's in design. Montreal, however, isn't always known for its love of good architecture. The location makes getting to downtown and the St Catherine Street areas very easy and you're in easy walking distance of just about everything else that wouldn't require a bus ride anyway . The room was clean and of a good size for two people. All of the rooms have a small balcony, which is a boon if you have to smoke, as all hotels in Montreal are non-smoking. The room was made up each day, although on a couple of occasions this was as late as 15:00. All of the rooms have a separate kitchen area with a cooker, microwave, toaster, coffee maker, fridge and sink. This is a real bonus for longer stays. We managed to cook a meal for guests on one occasion and prepared our own breakfast each day. The included breakfast in the breakfast room is on the mediocre side of okay but we only tried it once and decided to fend for ourselves instead. All of the cafes in Montreal make good coffee with the possible exception of "Second Cup", but that's just my personal opinion, so why drink coffee in the hotel? The breakfast room also contains a Computer and printer, the ice machine and a coke vending machine. There is nothing as grand as a "business centre" but all of the rooms have wireless and wired Internet access with a decent speed. You only get a code for one machine so if you have an iPod as well you would need to get two codes at check-in. Major positives for the hotel are the roof level pool and open rooftop terrace with a great view towards the mountain and over towards the Olympic Stadium. The pool shuts at 22:00 but both are well worth a visit. Also up on the16th are a sauna room and a laundry room. There are several exercise machines in the pool room if you feel the need. Downside 1: The air conditioning. Each room has a unit under the window of the main room. The unit is very loud when running and if you're a light sleeper you will not get to sleep with it on. Looking at the room layout on the door I would suspect that the rooms with a separate bedroom don't have any AC in the second room and Montreal gets very hot in the summer. Warning: If you are on the lower floors at the rear of the hotel. The building next door is in the process of becoming a McGill residence and its air conditioning units vent with so much noise that you will not be able to sleep with the windows open to get around the noisy AC in the room. I should think anything below the 10th floor would have an issue. Obviously if you visit in the winter this will not be a problem. Downside 2: The lifts. There are two and you share them with the staff so when the rooms are being cleaned expect to wait for one empty enough to use. No big deal if you are not in a hurry. Downside 3: There is a ventilation duct over the bathroom door which allows you to clearly hear any conversation, or anything else, occurring in your direct neighborsâ€™ bathroom. Be warned. Our interactions with the staff were always pleasant and overall and despite the downsides mentioned, we were happy with the hotel and the price we paid and have added it to our list of OK places to stay in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Reeennneee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 days in May. I thought it was a great value and the location was the best. It's in the Downtown Area convenient to all of the museums, shops, transportation, McGill University and other sites. Despite other reviewers' comments, I did not find that the elevator service was a problem and the airconditioner did work fine. An added benefit was that the price for the room was good in comparison to other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value- Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: kmrcga
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with cleanliness of rooms. We stayed in the one bedroom suite with our daughter sleeping on pull out sofa bed. This is not a luxury hotel and we were a bit nervous with some of the reviews, but this hotel exceeded our expectations for the price we paid. We booked it via the sweet deal package on the Montreal tourism site so got outstanding rate. Wireless internet worked well and breakfast was adequate. Gym equipment is sparse and being located with pool would be too hot to work out on it. Close to everything in downtown Montreal so was conveniently located. Front desk staff was excellent. Downfall is no where to park out front to unload luggage so that was inconvenient. If you are exhausted after walking around Montreal the restaurant across the road in the holiday inn express was well priced for a hotel restaurant and the food was excellent, so it is a good spot if you don't want to walk anymore.

Reviews.Title: “No bellhop and slow maid service”
Reviews.Author: whatwhatMontreal
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the sister-hotel of L'appartement hotel last year - ie, the Square Phillips - and it was elegant and excellent value for money, with good service, nice amenities, efficient staff and in a great location. In comparison, this place near the Mcgill university is also pretty central in location and there is good shopping nearby. And, L'appartement hotel is also clean and good value for money with good decor. BUT there is no security guard or even a bellhop on site - which can be a nasty surprise for long-distance travellers who aren't young and have heavy baggage. And the room cleaners won't turn up till half the day is over even if you hang the room-clean sign on your door before 10 am. The elevators are also old and narrow. The other strange thing was that, even if the central heating was reportedly switched off, the room felt very warm at night for some inexplicable reason - in April? And, the walls are fairly thin; so our neighbour's tv woke us up when he switched it on after 3 am!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a good deal”
Reviews.Author: dgdevil
Reviews.Content: Headline says it all - next to McGill and all the coeds! I'm here now using their Internet. That's the one small quibble. I asked the guy when I checked in if there was an Internet terminal. He said I would have to go to the nearby cafe. But then I noticed this one in the breakfast room. The elevators are fine - I think some people had complained about them? Rubbish! I would (and will) definitely come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: OntarioTrekker
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days recently and it was great location, right in the centre of most things for tourists. We got the Montreal Sweet Deal package with breakfast and it also came with coupons and a small gift of hand lotion. The unit had a very servicable kitchen, 2 very comfortable beds and a good sized bathroom. It's a continental breakfast but it did include lots of variety of things including lots of fruit and juice. The hotel has easy access to the metro and bus lines and is also close to several museums and good restaurants. The desk staff was extremely helpful with directions and suggestions as to what to do and see. Overall a great experience. Turn left out of the hotel and head toward Parc Street.. grocery store and lots of restaurants - 5 min walk; also a pharmacy is located just to the right of the door.

Reviews.Title: “I'll stay here again !”
Reviews.Author: NJ_Thomas
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at L'Appartment Hotel for a long weekend with my wife and 16 year old son. I booked a 1 bedroom suite which was very spacious and comfortable,had a well equipped kitchen, free wireless internet, and flat panel TV . The hotel also offers an indoor rooftop pool which was much larger than I expected and an outdoor deck. Continental breakfast is included in the room rate. I was extremely pleased with the accommodations and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT, for those seeking the bare neccessities & convenience”
Reviews.Author: skratchadelic
Reviews.Content: Depending on the traveler, this hotel can be a great value or a great disappointment. For my wife and I, it was an excellent value & exceeded our expectations. We are not wealthy travelers who are accustom to luxury, however we have more needs than the average college-student / back-packer hotel guest. We are somewhere in-between those extremes, and so is this hotel. It's not too expensive, not too fancy, but has more than enough comfort and convenience, and everything you need, including spacious rooms, helpful staff, cleanliness, parking (costs extra but worth it), free internet access, breakfast, convenient location (to public transportation, and restaurants).... As well as air-conditioning, great water pressure, and quick elevators. I don't have a single complaint. Worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Grate hotel & location for the price”
Reviews.Author: Toaimi
Reviews.Content: i recommend this hotel for a long stay especially if you are moving around the county. we are a family of ( 2 adults and 3 kids) where the appartment was roomy to take all of us generosity. the service was great, i got a good price for 1 bedroom apartment from the hotel directly for 30 days (mid July till mid Aug) including the breakfast buffet, internet access, and indoor pool in the rooftop. the housekeeping services was there all the time. The hotel is located in the top middle of the downtown, it was so easy to reach every thing by walk.. to the metro. i rented a car and the parking was available under the building was close for me. they have a great size indoor pool for free, washing and dryer machines (payable). since my apartment was in the third floor the only thing i can say is the bedroom (with ceiling fan) was not airconditioned to reduce the streat noise while we are sleeping while the living room was airconditioned .. so ask for higher floors apartment ... the 10th and above.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Friendly and A Real Bargain”
Reviews.Author: mammageek
Reviews.Content: I am a former Montrealer and until recently never really needed to stay in a hotel in my beautiful city. This hotel was never on my radar screen but now I want to let everyone know what a find it is. Affordable ($139 CAD) and convenient, close to shopping and the subways and best of all great restaurants on St Denis!. The room came with well supplied kitchen including a real stove. The room was clean and pleasant and breakfast was served daily. Big plus was free internet. What more can you ask for? The parking was $18 and I had a few issues parking in the garage but all in, I will return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay..........”
Reviews.Author: sharrona_9
Reviews.Content: i was relocated from my home due to water damage and i stayed at this hotel for 28 days our stay was great .i stayed in the 2 bedroom suite on the 16 floor and the views were amazing the staff was very friendly and polite. the hotel was extremely clean.after researching many hotels there rates were pretty reasonable.on may occasions my stay had to be extended and the hotel staff was very accommodating i would definitely recommended this hotel i would have to say my stay was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “You could do better for the money / terrible service”
Reviews.Author: MsCecile
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here before with much success. The hotel has really gone down overall in service and cleanliness. We were quite dissapointed. We stayed in a suite. It was very warm. They had an old ineffecient ac only in the living area. The bedroom was too hot to sleep. The fan was broken on high speed and the window would not open. We asked for them to fix it until we went down again hours later and a different man was there. The room was generally old and musty. No one is there to help you with your bags. The women at the front desk couldn't understand my reservation and there was mixup as to a prior cancellation. Also, I became quite ill in the hallway near my room and my key did not work. The maid refused to let me in my room. The sent another women up who was quite rude and refused to let me in my room also. After 20 minutes they sent the manager up after a great deal of panic and begging to let me in. I finally became sick all over myself in the hallway. Even after that incident the manager insisted he see an ID. After the humilation and begging they let me in. My husband finally came out of the room and sternly let the office now our displeasure. We immediately left the hotel and will never return. I don't think I have ever been treated that poorly in any service environment. Considering a low to medicore interior and awful service environment it just not worth saving an extra 20.00 dollars when there are lovely hotels close by.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for heat waves!!”
Reviews.Author: nbdoc
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 suites for two families with 1 and 2 kids ages 5-8. The rooms are spacious enough, and a kitchenette is a plus to keep some milk for the kids, and wine and cheese for the grown-ups. Location is not bad (a few blocks south and west would have been perfect), but it's very difficult to park in front of the hotel to load/unload on arrival and check-out. Long-term parking is rented from the other hotel across the street. Rooms are plenty spacious and fairly clean, although our bedding didn't get changed during our 3 night stay. The staff is pleasant, but help with luggage does not exist. Breakfast is reasonable. The pool on the top floor was a nice feature, kids really unwound there after the day of sightseeing. Two worst things about this hotel: AC and elevator. We were unlucky to get 90F in Motreal at the end of August, our 1 bdrm suite only had one tired, noisy, inefficient AC in the living room. The fan in the bedroom vibrated too much to sleep under it safely. We opened the window with little relief - just to be awaken by a construction on the street at 5:30 AM (another example of bad luck). The hallways are also not airconditioned. There are only two small, slow elevators for the entire buildings, and they are heavily utilized by maintenance staff, whose linen carts take up entire space. We never bothered to wait for the elevator to go down, but you could spend 10 minutes (really) waiting if you want to use it. Overall, it's an average discount property in a reasonably good location, OK if you travel with kids, but I would stay away from it during the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Leezee75
Reviews.Content: This is a very reasonably priced hotel on Sherbrooke St. Sainte-Catherine Street was an easy walk away, as well as Crescent Street. We enjoyed being able to cook our own meals and have a bedroom separate from the living space. Room was a good size for the two of us. Pros: - Free internet (can borrow an Ethernet cable from the front desk) - Full kitchen in your room to prepare meals - Free contentinental breakfast, - balcony Cons: - parking garage was unavailabe so we had to park at another hotel across the street (temporary problem) - we were on the second floor (206) and it was quite noisy - request a higer floor if possible. Overall, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly great!”
Reviews.Author: GordonMelkford
Reviews.Content: Young couple stayed here for 10 nights during July 2008, for a vacation in Montreal during the comedy season (Just for Laughs). Perhaps unusually, we wanted to make a lot of our own meals, and needed to work a fair amount on our laptops. The location was great, on the main Rue Sherbrooke artery, near some major museums, and a reasonable walk to much of the city. There's a Provigo supermarket a couple of blocks away which was fantastic for buying food, and lots of cafes and eateries nearby (check out Avenue du Parc). Room was OK - nothing special design-wise, but it did the job. Kitchen was compact and had everything we needed, bathroom was fine too. We had a problem with the kitchen tap leaking, which they fixed immediately, except it never went completely cold after that. I couldn't be bothered complaining again, and we filled the kettle from the bathroom tap. We were on the 4th floor, with our window/balcony at the side of the building (not on Sherbrooke). This made the room pretty dark, and also left us near a huge noisy outdoor industrial fan. As a result we couldn't really concentrate on working with the windows or balcony door open - annoying. If you're going to spend considerable time in your room, worth asking for a high floor. Internet worked fine - EtherNet rather than WiFi. Breakfast was pretty good - like most places in North America, it was a bit of a carb-fest, but there was always fruit and fruit juice available. Worth getting to breakfast early - at around 9am there was generally no space to sit down, which meant either loitering around, or taking a tray up to our room. Judging by breakfast, the crowd at the hotel seemed mostly to be couples, often with kids. Lifts were a pain. With two to serve 16 floors, and the maintenance staff sharing them with the guests, we often had to wait 5+ minutes for a lift to arrive. And when one did, it was often filled up by a housekeeper and a huge wheeling laundry bin. From the 4th floor, going down stairs made more sense. Pool was great and a fair size - often had it all to myself during the morning or early afternoon. In the evening there was usually at least one family with kids using it, which meant no space to swim full lengths. Roof deck off the pool was very pleasant, although it is fairly unprotected and could get windy. One other minor annoyance - on checkout there was a phone call on our bill from the first day. We were surprised but didn't argue since we were in a rush and it was only a few $s. We realized afterwards it was probably left from the people who checked out of the room a few hours before we checked in. Hotel should be more careful about that. In general however, no complaints about the staff who were courteous and friendly. Bottom line: at the price, this was a great place to stay, with a few annoyances as above. It's also worth considering Le Square Phillips, the somewhat more upmarket (and expensive) sister establishment, which is located more towards the business district. And a tip: Check for deals on www.tourisme-montreal.org - we used the "Sweet Deal" which gave us a 16%ish discount.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great people!”
Reviews.Author: tylercraft
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, and in a great location. A couple blocks from the Fine Art museum, a couple blocks from the Contemporary Museum in the other direction, a couple blocks from the main drag on St. Laurent and a couple blocks from the metro to take you to old Montreal. Beautiful rooftop pool and beautiful rooftop deck with a patio that over looks Mount Royal. Overall, we loved it here. Only complaint would be that the bed in our studio was really hard. But I still slept alright!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lagotic
Reviews.Content: Am staying at the hotel now with my family. The rooms are clean, and in great condition. Overall, I think it is a great place to stay; in fact, I moved from another hotel to stay here. Here are the pluses and minuses, in my opinion. Pluses * Good location (close to restaurants and fun things) * Pool * Very nice, tastefully appointed rooms - big and recently refurnished * Staff is super nice * On-site parking that you do yourself, so you don't have to keep on tipping some valet or wait for your car * They don't charge for local calls (but do for 800 numbers) * High speed internet (but not wireless) * Balconies * Squeaky clean and nice smelling everywhere I've looked Minuses * lots of construction going on and is quite a bumpy ride to access their parking garage * "exercise room" consists of 2 or 3 treadmill machines next to the sun-drenched pool, with no tv or anything. Needless to say, it gets very steamy with the sun and the pool heat, at least in summer. * breakfast is all foods from the supermarket, e.g. kind of stale croissants, cereals, yogurt with lots of sugar and fruit. If you are looking for food, rather than food products, this breakfast is not the best. * Building is under-elevatored (i.e. you have to wait a long time at times) but so is every hotel I have visited here in Montreal. * No ramp up to building, so if you are in a wheelchair or have a stroller (we have a stroller), it is hard to get in. This is apparently true of all of Montreal though; they barely have curb cuts here - forget about ramps. Who knew the US could be more progressive than Canada! * No dishwasher in our room, don't know about others...

Reviews.Title: “Just Right!”
Reviews.Author: Readmytrip
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel to coincide with a trip to the Montreal Jazz Festival this past weekend, and my friend and I couldn't have asked for a better place to stay! We were within 5 minutes walking distance of the festival, so the location was ideal. Even if you aren't going to the festival, it's right in the middle of downtown, and we were close enough to walk to the park, the Latin Quarter, the old town, and to some of the coolest streets in the city. The hotel served a good continental breakfast- cereal, fresh fruit, juice, toast, bagels, etc. We stayed in the basic room with one bed, and the best part was definitely the small kitchen area. It had a refrigerator, stove, microwave, and also included bowls and plates and cutlery. There is a grocery nearby, and we went there one night to make our own dinner. The front desk staff were very helpful when we asked about side trips from Montreal, and they even called a few places for us that we wanted to visit. We had a balcony room, which was a nice surprise. The only drawback, and it's a minor one, is that there is a single computer available for use, so you might be waiting depending on if there's a line. We had rented a car, and they gave us daily parking tickets to park at a nice hotel garage across the street. It cost $18 a day, and we could come and go as we pleased with no additional cost. I would stay again at this hotel if I went back to Montreal! If you book it, check out the visit Canada website (or tourism Canada, I can't remember the exact site) for a discount. Ours was called 'Sweet Deal' and we received the 4th night half price, and they also gave us a welcome bag of Montreal maple syrup products on our arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great value”
Reviews.Author: QF_Fan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at L'Appartement from Oct. 17th to Oct. 23rd in one of their studio suites. For $133 per night plus tax, I was able to get a clean, comfortable suite in a good location in downtown Montreal. In addition to the usual things one would expect from a hotel suite, the studio suite included a kitchen and free in-room Internet access for those with a laptop computer. Network cords are available from the front desk if needed. Other facilities available in the hotel include an infrequently used pool on the top floor with views of the city, several exercise machines and a sauna. On the main floor, guests can also avail themselves of both a buffet-style continental breakfast (M-F 6:30-9:30, weekends 7:00-10:00) and a one-computer business centre at no extra charge. Service was consistently polite. The McGill Metro station, McGill University, Parc du Mont-Royal, Place Ville-Marie, the stores on Rue Ste.-Catherine and the McCord Museum are all within a brief walk. A Provigo supermarket is just down the street and around the corner on Avenue du Parc if you need groceries. The L'Aerobus shuttle stops here, and other tourist shuttles either stop here or at one of the three neighbouring hotels. The only negatives were that the walls were a bit thin, and my swimsuit still smelled strongly of chlorine even after rinsing. But those are just minor things. Overall, it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “L'Appartement Montreal”
Reviews.Author: MaturemanL
Reviews.Content: Family of 3 recently spent 3 nights at this wonderful appartment hotel in downtown Montreal. We walked in after we didn't like the rooms at the nearby Best Western on Sherbrooke. We stopped on Sherbrooke at this location where there are 5 hotels - the Marriot Courtyard,The Holiday Inn,The Delta,the Sheraton 4 points and L'Appartment. We started here and never got to see the rest! We got a one bedroom suite for the price of a studio - the rooms are large and airy'with a modern shower/bath and a great kitchen with all mod cons. We paid 139 CAD + Tax + $18 per day for garage parking for our rental car. Definitely a great find in pricy Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: dannykiv
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 two bedroom Suites for my bachelor party, and it worked out real nice. We stayed in Rooms 1109 and 1209, and while the beds were a little small -- 11 people fit in the 2 rooms just fine. There were plenty of towels, and the fridge was a regular size, perferct for storing beer. Location was top notch -- everything was with 10 blocks and definately walkable. The staff was very friendly (and only charged us at the room rate of 2 people per room). Lastly, breakfast was included (and is open to any one/group who has a room key to get into the breakfast room.) While it wasn't spectacular (mainly toast, cereal, muffins, starch, etc.) it was the right price.

Reviews.Title: “A Great choice”
Reviews.Author: RickandRos
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel and have nothing to criticise. The entrance is rather formal and the desk staff are very professional, (though friendly and helpful) so you would think you were in a business hotel as you go in. Our room was spotless, well appointed and perfectly large enough for us two. The kitchenette has everything you need. We had a balcony that looks out onto Sherbrooke Street west. It was nice to have but small, and, I found, a bit vertiginous. If you want to sit outside its better to go up to the penthouse where next to the pool thereâ€™s a rooftop deck with views over the City and nearby Mont Royale. A good continental breakfast is provided. Itâ€™s plentiful, though not very varied The hotel is certainly in a popular spot. There is a Sheraton next door, a Holiday Inn and a Marriott across the road; and a Hilton is going up next to that. Itâ€™s an easy walk to the subway, McGill University, the underground City and the information place on Dorchester square â€“ and only a moderate walk to the waterfront and the Old city. There are plenty of restaurants nearby, and a supermarket. We parked in the basement for 18 dollars a day (plus taxes, of course). Free internet access and computer are provided in the breakfast room which was very convenient for us, on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Suite bargain”
Reviews.Author: ecargo
Reviews.Content: I stayed with friends at the L'appartement Hotel in July, and was extremely happy with the hotel's amenities and location. We stayed in a one-bedroom suite, complete with kitchenette, queen bed in the bedroom, and double sofa bed in the living room. The suite was huge and very clean with nice views of Montreal. The Metro was a 5 minute walk, and we were in walking distance of the shopping and restaurant districts. Very pleased with the property, the location, and the service. Would be a great bargain for a family at $120 a night, but note that that price doesn't include taxes, and in the end we payed almost $200 a night. Still a good deal for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to love it but . . .”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaGolds
Reviews.Content: I so very much wanted to love this hotel. Last year we had a wonderful experience at the (jointly owned) Square Phillipe, and I had these grand ambitions of single-handedly raising the TA ranking of this poor overlooked hotel. However, after our 3 day stay, I agree that this hotel is really just a 3 star hotel. Our 2 bedroom suite was easily 600 square feet and had a beautiful view. However only one of the bedrooms had air conditioning (and a small window unit at that) There was also only one television, and that was in the living room. The kitchen was fully stocked with everything we needed (A grocery store is a short 2 block walk) and the dining area was large enough for a pack-n-play for my toddler. We slept 5 people no problem. (I thought the pull-out sofa was uncomfortable but my 9 year old didn't mind it) The biggest con of this hotel is the elevators. There are only 2 very small elevators to service 17 floors. Our wait at peak times was often 10 minutes or more. I found the breakfast to be very adequate (bagels, cereal, coffee, juice, muffins, fruit) for a continental. Additionally the breakfast room had a computer with internet and a printer available 24/7 for guest use. The rooftop had a small inddor pool and laundramat which was also a nice added feature. I also liked the location very much, a short walk to the metro, the contemporary art museum and some very nice restaurants. However I would choose the Square Phillipe over LeAppartment next time.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: DaveLIsa
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay here was only OK; no more no less. Problems included a suite with only a room air conditioner in the living room leaving the bedroom uncomfortable, an incredibly hard and noisy bed which left us sore in the morning, parking in the hotel across the street (not too convenient in the rain, or any other time for that matter) and a buffet with fairly low quality offerings. On the positive side, the room was clean and the staff friendly if not always efficient. On one occasion we had called the front desk to report no hot water and I was promised a return call which never came. I will say when I inquired again, the same staff member did apologize for failing to call me back. The location is convenient and cabs are easy to get out front. On balance, though, we would not return here.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended - well priced and so spacious”
Reviews.Author: rachdav
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with husband and two children (6 and 9) in a 1 bed apartment. The apartment was so spacious with a full size diing table and chairs, sofabed and recliner chair (that the kids loved) Great kitchen although we didn't use it other than coffee. Pool was clean and we were the only users each time. Breakfast was simple but plentiful and an added bonus. Good location for easy access to Eaton Centre and underground. Well recommended for families who need that extra space and the facility to make food if required. Overall, very satisfying and enjoyable start to our holiday in Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: gammij
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Appartement in early April 2007 with my family of four. Staff was cordial and helpful. The 2 bedroom suite was clean and roomy. The kitchen came in handy as we ate in several times. The breakfast was plentiful and apprecitated by the kids who loved the toaster and the Eggo waffles. We never saw another sole in the swimming pool or the saunas. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, affordable price”
Reviews.Author: aka2006
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the 3 night stay at the L'Appartement Hotel in Montreal. The room we stayed in was a 1 bedroom sweet with a kitchen which is very nice especially for a family with kids. The rooms are not fancy but clean. The hotel has a nice swimming pool and complimentary continental breakfast provided. The only disadvantage is uncomfortable mattress and pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a fantastic spot, just two blocks from Rue Saint Catherine. My husband and I went up to see the Jazz Festival for a night, and were thrilled that we didn't have to pay for a cab or the metro. The hotel itself was pretty clean, and the staff were friendly. However, the elevator is extremely small and usually there is a line for it...kinda strange when you keep in mind that this hotel is designed for long term stays (every room, even the basic one we rented, has a full kitchen), meaning most people would have a lot of luggage. Also, if you want to use the underground parking, it is 17.50 CAD/day, and there are only a few spaces (get there early!). The basement you park in is very tight and hard to manuever around in, so be careful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaggieQu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a week in May. I am usually wary of hotels that include kitchenettes, but this hotel was immaculate and ideal. It is centrally located (right downtown by McGill University) and walking distance to the Metro and buses. We asked for a room off of Sherbrooke Street and had our windows open the entire week. It was very quiet. An excellent breakfast was included in the price. We entertained friends and family at the hotel and so found the sitting room and fridge ideal. The staff were extremely helpful. I wouldn't hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “A very friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the apt. for 2 1/2 mths, the ppl are friendly, thumb up for their service and the manager Steve is a wonderful man!

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mayre123
Reviews.Content: After reading all the positive reviews about this hotel I was a bit disappointed when we experienced it first hand. The room was okay, nothing special. Not huge, just average. Carpet had pulls and appeared to need a cleaning. Kitchen/dining area tile floor was very dirty, I had to clean it as soon as we checked into our room as we have a toddler that would be roaming around on hands and knees. Bathroom was fine, bedroom okay too. Very hard to navigate hotel with stroller though. No ramps or handicap areas. Only stairs to front door and tiny hallways in back of hotel. Walls were paper-thin. We heard every conversation in the rooms around us, above us and in the hallway. The fire alarm went off in the building at 5:45 am and everyone crowded into staircase to get out of building. We were on the 11th floor so it was quite a ways down. The problem was that after the fire department declared the building okay to enter again, the elevators would not work. So, after almost 2 hours of waiting downstairs, we had to lug ourselves and baby up 11 flights of stairs. Management never offered any explanation, never apologized and never made any announcement as to what was going on during this frightening experience. In fact they told my husband that it was not the hotels fault that this kind of thing happens frequently. We were very disappointed with attitude of staff and management. Most likely would not stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: L'Appartement Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 455 Rue Sherbrooke Ouest, Montreal, Quebec H3A 1B7, Canada
